body.p: To his excellency Thomas E. Bramlet Gov of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Your petitioner Samuel Denham would respectfully represent unto your excellency that at the presant term of Whitly circuit Court he was fined the sum of Seventy five Dollars for failing to put up the tavern rates as fixed by the County Court in the publick room of his house.
your petitioner did not know that the law required him to do so he had no information that the rates had been fixed by the County Court.

your petitioner states that as soon as he asertained that it was his duty to put up the rates he complied with the law your petitioner prays your excellency to interpose your pardoning power & remit said fine
I hope your excellency will remit the above fine
This fine ought to be remited according to my opinion if I had the power to do so I would remit the fine
Pleas present this petition to his excelleny as soon consonent & procure & send a remission of the fine to me as early as you conveniently can and you will much oblige your friend truly

Whitley Cir Ct

S. Denham
